Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Gambicin (natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates,  animals; 4S=S)
Sequence Information.Source: midgut, fatbody, and hemocyte-like cell; mosquito,Anopheles gambiae

Literature Information.Literature: The oxidized form was active against E. coli (MIC 6.25-12.5 uM) and M. luteus (MIC 25-50 uM). It also has an effect on filamentus fungus and rodent malaria parasite P. berghei. The reduced form is less active. Updated 5/13/2014.
Literature Information.Author: Vizioli J, Bulet P, Hoffmann JA, Kafatos FC, MÃ¼ller HM, Dimopoulos G.2001
Literature Information.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2001 Oct 23;98(22):12630-5.Pub-Med.
Literature Information.Title: Gambicin: a novel immune responsive antimicrobial peptide from the malaria vector Anopheles gambiae
